title: Support Kills
body: Why do people get so mad if a support is getting kills... if their ADC dies, or if they're in team fight, it's gonna happen and everyone, including the other team, gets all butthurt and starts calling KS on the support. Sorry, but the perfect 0/0/ALLTEAMKILLS score is really hard to achieve. And when your support gets a quadra kill in a team fight, be happy they shut down someone who is "unstoppable" and turned the game in your team's favor rather than rage at them. Supports are supposed to support the team, I get it, but when we get kills, trust me, we don't purposely try and KS from you, and we're trying to help.

replies.body: As an ADC main i don't care if I get the kill or you get the kill. As long as the enemy is dead I am good, but if you are deliberately trying to do it then I will get mad

there is no support Draven. Draven does it all....with style. And that means he is ALWAYS the carry.
He does it all though, so he's Support, ADC, APC, Tank, Fighter, Assassin and Draaaaven all at the same time.

In my experience the problem with the sup  getting the kill instead of the adc means that the adc gets less gold which means it takes longer for the adc to get items. so if the adc is dead and you secure the kill that is great at least someone gets the kill and the gold and hopefully the adc get assist gold. but if your dueling it out and sup just happen to use their ability at the last second and the sup gets the kill the issue there is as a sup with the right amount of skill you should be able to know when to hold onto that ability rather than casting it if you know your adc will be capable of getting the kill. which will lead to not only a happy adc but a fed one with lots of items and carry potential.

I'd rather throw out that last second ability to make sure they die than have them potentially get saved by flash/escape/jungler and/or support intervention and then no one gets the kill. End if the day, a guy is dead and your ADC gets some time to free farm, giving them a cs lead and the assist gold to get them ahead just as much as getting a kill would.
It's called kill secured for a reason.

Dude isn't wrong though, and there are definitely situations where you don't need to take the kill immediately to secure it. Sometimes securing it is just walking behind the champ not pushing Sona Q quite yet.

There are three situations I don't care if I "KS" the ADC in:

1) I'm doing tons of damage playing something like Zyra, I'm not going to try to take all the kills but if it's a brawl in lane I'm just going to go all out.

2) The ADC or I is at risk of death.

3) There is a decent chance they'll get away if I don't. 

Those situations do come up a lot, and anyone who gets mad about them is dumb. But the rest of the time, it's pretty easy to not take it.

as someone who usually is either an adc or a support, let me just say this. being a support is hard. you have to wait a huge amount of time just to get your first builds, and after that, it'll take even longer. 
ADCs don't have as big of an issue, as long as you're smart and farm up, you should have a good solid amount of cs throughout the game. 
So do I think that the ADC should rage when their support gets a kill? no. go farm some creeps, take dragon, take a tower, whatever. Your support just got a huge boost in their gold. they can get shit to help you. get 20 cs and you've got as much as that kill was, and in the downtime between the kills, they can back, get their gubs, come back, so you can go ham and get a double when your laners return
While ADCs are good to have fed, you gotta remember you're still very much fragile. let your support be your babysitter and keep you alive. 
supports getting kills ensures that _someone _ gets the kill. it lets them do better at their job. don't get mad and rage your support for getting a kill.

ah well, we all have to learn when and when not to attack, something i can always improve on... till then though...

I remember losing a game because I accidentally stole the first 5 kills from a Draven... and then he died and lost his stacks... still not really sure how that happened.

In normal circumstances tho, the difference between a kill and an assist in lane phase is only 150g. There's a reason you want that gold on the adc, but the real value of the kill is that the enemy misses cs/loses tower/can't contest drake so it really doesn't matter that much. And people who complain about ks in teamfights are ridiculous, at that point the whole reason behind teamfighting is so you can take more objectives.

Though it is actually optimal to get all the kills on the same champion usually
Because of assist streaks which gives up bonus gold on assist up to 60 bonus gold or something
and shutdown bonus caps at 500 so if that champion get a lot more kills it won't increase the teams bounty

I play Nami a lot, and used to hold off on healing because it bounces and gets kills until two games in a row the enemy ADC turned and erased my ADC who I thought was going to get the kill. Now I do not care who gets the kill so long as the enemy is dead. It's not worth the risk holding my heal so you can get the kill.

I personally don't get mad when a support takes a kill as long as its not just griefing, and It saddens me every single time I see a support afraid to get a kill because an enemy sometimes ends up getting away when even an assist would have been better than nothing, and supports do need gold too.

It makes me really angry when I see players bashing the supports for no reason over a kill including when players rage just because a support gets a kill in a group fight, Well your support did nothing wrong, there is no reason they need to stop and say sorry for helping your mates.
